ff_issue.jpg

User Agent: Opera/9.80 (Windows NT 6.1; U; de) Presto/2.9.168 Version/11.51

Steps to reproduce:

I'm using Firefox 7.0.1 together with Display Fusion 3.4.0 which made this problem obvious as Display Fusion adds additional buttons to the FF title bar located on the left of the general button 'minimize', 'maximize' and 'close' (see screenshot).

This problem only occurs if Firefox is maximized!

I disabled the function 'Tabs on top' in FF as the additional buttons were hidden when many tabs where open (feature of Display Fusion). The Display Fusion buttons are automatically placed left to the windows buttons. As Firefox reserves some space for the drop down arrow (for open tabs and grouping tabs), they are pushed a bit more to the left (see screenshot).


Actual results:

The tabs were displayed correctly below the address bar, but the reserved space for the down arrow has not been removed. There is still some kind of placeholder where it makes no sense. This hinders the buttons from being placed correctly next to the Windows buttons.


Expected results:

It is expected that this reserved space is removed as soon as the tabs are not placed any more on top. The behaviour should be the same like when FF is not maximized. If Firefox is not maximized, the tabs automatically are below the address bar and then there is no space reserved for the down array (see screenshot again).
